meanings.definition: In favor of labor unions or workers' rights.
meanings.sent1: She always votes for pro-labor candidates who support workers' rights.
meanings.sent2: The pro-labor movement aims to improve working conditions for all employees.
meanings.sent3: The pro-labor activists organized a peaceful protest for fair wages.
meanings.sent4: Her pro-labor stance is as strong as a foundation supporting a tall building.
meanings.sent5: The pro-labor policies have led to better benefits for workers across the country.

meanings.definition: To support or advocate for labor unions or workers' rights.
meanings.sent1: The organization decided to prolabour the workers' demands for better pay.
meanings.sent2: Many individuals prolabour for equal treatment of all employees in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: He prolabours tirelessly to ensure fair treatment for all workers.
meanings.sent4: She prolabours like a dedicated champion for the rights of laborers.
meanings.sent5: The union leader prolabours for improved safety measures in factories.
